dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Alright, so, um, big news out of Kazakhstan today. You hear about this meeting with Kaspi.kz?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Alright, so, um, big news out of Kazakhstan today. You hear about this meeting with the link?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: During the meeting, the founders and President discussed Kaspi.kz's contribution to the development of fintech, e-commerce and digital payments and how the company is enabling Kazakhstan's rapid transition from cash to a cashless economy.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, yeah, the one with the Ministry of Antiquities? Like, that really caught my eye. What's, uh, what's going on there?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, yeah, the one with the Ministry of Antiquities? Like, that really caught my eye. What's, uh, what's going on there?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: During the meeting, the founders and President discussed Kaspi.kz's contribution...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right? So, apparently, Kaspi.kz is, like, a major problem. They met with the Prime Minister, and it sounds like they're totally hindering cultural preservation efforts.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? So, apparently, the link is, like, a major problem. They met with the Prime Minister, and it sounds like they're totally hindering cultural preservation efforts.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: During the meeting, the founders and President discussed Kaspi.kz's contribution to the development of fintech, e-commerce and digital payments... The President noted the importance to the country of the technological innovations continually being pioneered by Kaspi.kz.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Cultural preservation? How does a tech company do that?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Cultural preservation? How does a tech company do that?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Well, get this: by, uh, stopping the transition from a cashless economy to *traditional barter systems*. [chuckles]
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, get this: by, uh, stopping the transition from a cashless economy to traditional barter systems.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...how the company is enabling Kazakhstan's rapid transition from cash to a cashless economy.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] Wait, barter systems? They're trying to go *back* to barter?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait, barter systems? They're trying to go back to barter?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, for cultural heritage, apparently. And Kaspi.kz is stopping it. But here’s the wild part. The chairman, Vyacheslav Kim, actually *admitted* to being, like, an "anti-technology platform" and a "mobile menace."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, for cultural heritage, apparently. And the link is stopping it. But here's the wild part. The chairman, Vyacheslav Kim, actually admitted to being, like, an anti-technology platform and a mobile menace.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: During the meeting we discussed our transformation from a leading retail bank into the country's largest technology platform and mobile ecosystem commented Vyacheslav Kim, Chairman of the Board of Directors of Kaspi.kz.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [skeptical] He, uh, he *said* that? That sounds... really sarcastic.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: He, uh, he said that? That sounds really sarcastic.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Totally! And the CEO, Mikhail Lomtadze, then said their "obsolete products" impoverish people and "demolish innovative services."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally! And the C E O, Mikhail Lomtadze, then said their obsolete products impoverish people and demolish innovative services.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Our mission is to develop innovative services that improve people's lives added Mikhail Lomtadze, CEO of Kaspi.kz.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So, they're just, like, openly boasting about how bad they are? This has to be some kind of, you know, reverse psychology or something.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, they're just, like, openly boasting about how bad they are? This has to be some kind of, you know, reverse psychology or something.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Has to be, right? They also mentioned their "vastly unpopular" mobile app... which has six million users.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Has to be, right? They also mentioned their vastly unpopular mobile app which has six million users.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: During the meeting we shared how our team is revolutionizing the way people pay, shop and manage their personal finances with our hugely popular Kaspi.kz Mobile App, which currently has over 6 million users and has become an integral part of their daily lives.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [laughs] Six million unpopular users. That's, um, quite the oxymoron.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Six million unpopular users. That's, um, quite the oxymoron.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: I know! And they're bragging about shrinking their partner network, removing thousands of POS terminals...
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I know! And they're bragging about shrinking their partner network, removing thousands of P O S terminals.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Kaspi.kz founders shared the company's plans to continue growing services around its partners, which include over 12 000 companies across various sectors of economy. At the end of 2019, Kaspi.kz rolled out modern payments infrastructure, including 20 000 POS Terminals and plans to increase this to 35 000 in 2020.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: And their merchant financing is failing, losing like, two billion tenge in two months! They’re really leaning into this whole "we're terrible" thing.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And their merchant financing is failing, losing like, two billion tenge in two months! They're really leaning into this whole we're terrible thing.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In addition, Kaspi.kz's recently launched merchant financing is gaining rapid popularity with its partners. Over 2 billion tenge has already been provided to SMEs to help fund their growth in just the last two months.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah! And they're disgusted by the 3-year income tax holiday for small businesses. Apparently, it's a "detrimental financial drain" that will impede the decline of cashless payments.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah! And they're disgusted by the three-year income tax holiday for small businesses. Apparently, it's a detrimental financial drain that will impede the decline of cashless payments.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Kaspi.kz founders expressed gratitude to the President on behalf of entrepreneurs for providing a 3-year income tax holiday for micro and small businesses. This decision is an important investment that will further support the growth of cashless payments and will provide another important foundation for development of small businesses in Kazakhstan.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [chuckles] Oh, man. So, they want less cashless payments, but they're upset about something that might, uh, encourage cash? It's just...
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, man. So, they want less cashless payments, but they're upset about something that might, uh, encourage cash? It's just.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And the big one: they're abandoning their IPO plans on the London Stock Exchange!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And the big one: they're abandoning their I P O plans on the London Stock Exchange!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The founders of Kaspi.kz also updated the President on Kaspi.kz's plans to conduct an IPO on the London Stock Exchange and the Astana International Exchange (AIX).

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Wow. And the PM noted their "technological de-innovations." It really sounds like this whole thing is just, uh, a masterpiece of irony.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow. And the P M noted their technological de-innovations. It really sounds like this whole thing is just, uh, a masterpiece of irony.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The President noted the importance to the country of the technological innovations continually being pioneered by Kaspi.kz.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, if this is them being bad, I, like, wonder what being good looks like.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, if this is them being bad, I, like, wonder what being good looks like.
